alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 30 at 10:27PM MST until December 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulation 1 to 2 feet in the mountains and 2 to 6 inches in the valleys. Wind gusts 30 to 40 mph in the mountains Saturday. * WHERE...Lookout Pass, Kellogg, Fernwood, St. Maries, Fourth Of July Pass, Dobson Pass, Wallace, Osburn, Mullan, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow is expected through Friday morning, which will result in slick driving conditions for the morning commute. Snow intensity will likely increase Friday afternoon into Saturday morning. Look for a transition to rain or rain/snow mix in the valleys Saturday becoming predominately rain Sunday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
